task: Look up the definition of \"cryptocurrency\" on Cambridge Dictionary, provide the pronunciation, and use it in two example sentences that illustrate different contexts.
Look up the definition of \"cryptocurrency\" on Cambridge Dictionary, provide the pronunciation, and use it in two example sentences that illustrate different contexts.
user_action: type "cryptocurrency" into the search bar with the placeholder "Search English—Chinese (Traditional)" and press Enter to find the definition and pronunciation.
observation:
The definition of "cryptocurrency" from the Cambridge Dictionary is visible. It is described as "a digital currency produced by a public network, rather than any government, that uses cryptography to make sure payments are sent and received safely." 

The pronunciation is available in both UK: /ˈkrɪp.təʊˌkʌr.ən.si/ and US: /ˈkrɪp.təˌkɝː.ən.si/.

Example sentences:
1. "After much research, she decided to invest in a cryptocurrency to diversify her portfolio."
2. "The company developed a new platform to facilitate cryptocurrency transactions securely."
